author: Special Correspondent
text:
Eight fishermen of Nagapattinam were arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy when they were fishing mid-sea. The fishermen belong to Arcot Thurai and Perumalpettai coastal villages.

Police sources said four fishermen ventured into the sea from Arcot Thurai on March 1 afternoon in a fibre boat. They were arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy. Those arrested were S. Balamurugan (28), M. Kuttiandi (45), K. Kavinesan (20)- all from Arcot Thurai and A. Rajendran (35) of Siruthalaikadu.

Another group of four fishermen, which set sail in a fibre boat from Kodiakkarai on March 2, were also arrested.
title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests 8 Nagapattinam fishermen
